articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Lobbying Anti-DPRK Act
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Lobbying Anti-DPRK Act 
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- The DPRK condemned the south Korean group of traitors for their ongoing attempt to lobby "north Korean human rights act", extremely provocative to the DPRK, despite the strong protest of people at home and abroad.
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea made this criticism in its information bulletin No. 973 on Monday.
					
					 The act is an anti-reunification and confrontation law aimed at sinister political purposes to slander and defile the socialist system of the DPRK and the dignity of its leadership and undermine it from within, the bulletin said, adding:
					
					 The south Korean puppet group made several attempts so far to enact this law but failed with rejection by people at home and abroad.
					
					 Now it is again trying to railroad the law through the "National Assembly", which shows how far the group has gone in inciting confrontation.
					
					 The "north Korean human rights act" is an anti-reunification, treacherous and inhumane law much more vicious than the notorious "National Security Law" in terms of its character, purpose and contents.
					
					 Through this act, the group of traitors seeks to justify abduction of DPRK citizens, psychological warfare against it and other confrontation and smear campaigns and lay a legal foundation for such moves.
					
					 In this way it schemes to realize its pipedream about "contingency" and "unification under the liberal and democratic system."
					
					 Such attempt is just an official and total denial of the system, sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK and it is for legalizing confrontation in system with the DPRK. This is a reckless deed designed to totally break the north-south agreement on recognizing and respecting the system of each side and push the north-south relations deeper to deadlock and confrontation.
					
					 If the puppet group enacts the criminal act, the army and people of the DPRK who regard socialism as their life and soul will consider it as an official declaration of war against the system and people of the DPRK and the second "target case" and take decisive counteraction against it.
					
					 The group will be entirely to blame for unimaginable grave consequences to be entailed by its persistent moves to enact the anti-DPRK law despite the DPRK's warning, it said.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Congratulations to PM of Benin
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Congratulations to PM of Benin
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on June 18 sent a congratulatory message to Pascal Irenea Koupaki on his appointment as prime minister of Benin.
					 Expressing belief the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop, the message wished him success in his work for economic development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun also sent a similar message to Nassirou Arifari Bako on his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs, African Integration, Francophone countries and Overseas Compatriots on the same day.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun S. Korean Authorities' Remarks about "Apology" Blasted
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun S. Korean Authorities' Remarks about "Apology" Blasted
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- A mandarin of the south Korean puppet Ministry of Unification in a recent press interview blustered that south Korea would not "gloss over" the "Cheonan" warship case and the Yonphyong Island shelling incident, adding there would be no "next phase" of the inter-Korean relations unless the two cases are settled. He went the lengths of vociferating about "the unification of the systems," talking this or that about "the three-phase unification proposal" touted by the south Korean authorities. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The conspiratorial and provocative nature of the above-said two cases had already been brought to daylight. It was none other than the Lee Myung Bak group that spawned the two controversial cases. 
					
					 They were an inevitable product of the anti-DPRK confrontation policy of the conservative group as it pushed the inter-Korean relations to a collapse by hamstringing the efforts to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. 
					
					The Lee regime's policy of confrontation is still pursued and there is no knowing when it will spark military provocations. How there be "next phase" of the inter-Korean relations under this situation?  These relations have been practically frozen as the puppet forces are stepping up the moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK while groundlessly passing the buck for the two cases on it. The call for "admission and apology" made again by the above-said guy reminds one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 Their oft-repeated call for "apology" and the like is nothing but a subterfuge to shun the process to improve the inter-Korean relations and justify their policy of confrontation with the DPRK. Tight-cornered by the total failure of their policy toward the DPRK, the puppet forces are now working hard to evade the responsibility for the prevailing situation and intensify the confrontation racket in a bid to realize their wild ambition for "the unification of the systems." 
					
					 This is evidenced by their talk about the above-said proposal.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities do not wish to see the situation inch close to an uncontrollable phase, they had better stop talking about nonsensical "apology" and respond to the DPRK's call as early as possible, urges the commentary.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- A Jilin provincial youth friendship delegation of China led by Zhang Jingying, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the Communist Youth League of China, arrived here by air on Monday.

articles.title: Iranian Embassy Officials Observe DPRK-Iran Friendship Week
articles.content:
Iranian Embassy Officials Observe DPRK-Iran Friendship Week
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Morteza Moradian and staff members of the Iranian embassy here visited Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies on Monday on the occasion of the week of DPRK-Iran friendship.
					 The visitors toured a room dedicated to the history of the university and lecture rooms, being briefed on the fact that the university has trained competent talents with enough facilities needed for educational science.
					
					 They presented it with educational equipment and books.
					
					 Earlier, they had talks with officials of the DPRK on the matter of developing the relations between the two countries and enjoyed sports and amusement games at the Meari Shooting Gallery, deepening friendship.

articles.title: New Collection of Reminiscences Off Press
articles.content:
New Collection of Reminiscences Off Press
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- A collection of reminiscences "Among the People" (94) was published by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House.
					 The book contains 21 reminiscences dealing with the leadership exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and his noble virtues.
					
					 Reminiscences "Photograph Taken in front of His Birthplace" deals with the life of Kim Il Sung who dedicated his all to the country and the revolution and people till the last moments of his life.
					
					 Reminiscences "Boundlessly Modest Man" and "In the Experimental Field at the Foot of Mt. Kumsu" reflect the noble personality and virtues of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The book also contains reminiscences telling touching stories about the indefatigable field guidance given by the President to meet people and dynamic and wise leadership provided by him to bring about a steady surge in the socialist economic construction.
					
					 There are in the book reminiscences dealing with the personality of the President as a great man. They tell stories about how he helped ordinary officials, servicepersons and working people to become pillars of the country, what profound care and trust he showed for a south Korean revolutionary, what loving care he showed for the bereaved children of revolutionaries so that they might follow in their footsteps and what great favor he bestowed upon the agricultural workers.

articles.title: DPRK Makes Full Use of Rare-earth Minerals
articles.content:
DPRK Makes Full Use of Rare-earth Minerals 
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- An effective utilization of rare-earth minerals is of weighty significance in economic growth, said an official of the Ministry of State Resource Development.
					 Kim Hung Ju, vice department director of the ministry, told KCNA the DPRK government has paid much effort to the exploitation and utilization of rare-earth minerals.     
					
					 The country has large deposits of high-grade rare-earth minerals in west and east areas.
					
					 Prospecting work and mining have been launched in the areas and detailed exploration of new deposits is going on in a far-sighted way in areas with favorable mining conditions.
					
					 Meanwhile, scientific institutes have intensified researches in various rare-earth elements.

articles.title: Ceramic Table Lamp
articles.content:
Ceramic Table Lamp
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- On display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK is a ceramic table lamp.
					 It is a gift presented to leader Kim Jong Il by Mutsuko Miki, wife of a former Japanese prime minster. 
					
					 It is a custom of the Japanese people to present one's own making to respected persons.
					
					 She learned ceramic technique and made the lamp by herself to repay deep concern paid to her family by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Upon hearing the news that Kim Jong Il was elected general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, she presented the gift to him in November Juche 86 (1997.)

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Abandon Confrontation Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Abandon Confrontation Policy
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Anders Karlsson, chairman of the Communist Party of Sweden, issued a statement on June 13 to mark the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The adoption of the joint declaration was an unprecedented event that opened up a new chapter in the Korean people's history of reunification movement, the statement said.
					
					 But the Lee Myung Bak-led reactionary and treacherous forces of south Korea scrapped all the north-south agreements made in the June 15 era and are frequently committing the war exercises against the DPRK under the baton of the U.S., it noted.
					
					 Expressing full support for the June 15 joint declaration and its action program, the October 4 declaration, the statement strongly urged the south Korean authorities to stop at once the moves for confrontation among the nation.

articles.title: Pullout of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Demanded
articles.content:
Pullout of U.S. Forces from S. Korea Demanded
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification issued a statement on June 13, nine years since two schoolgirls Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son were mercilessly killed by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea.
					 The statement recalled that the U.S. forces drove an armored car over the two schoolgirls on roadside to death in June 2002.
					
					 Crimes by the U.S. forces in south Korea continue without letup such as murder, violence, robbery, environment pollution and war maneuvers, it charged.
					
					 This year alone witnessed the case of outrage on an old couple in Tongduchon of Kyonggi Province and defoliant burial cases, now being disclosed one after another, the statement noted, saying: They fully reveal the true colors of the vicious U.S. forces depending on war of aggression and plunder.
					
					 It expressed the resentment at the reality in which the pro-American sycophantic and treacherous forces are defending the U.S. forces' crimes under the unequal south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" while cracking down on the popular masses aspiring after independence against the U.S.
					
					 All the people will pool their efforts to wage a dynamic struggle to achieve independence against the U.S. and punish the treacherous regime and thus remove the U.S. military bases, hotbed of crimes, and drive out the U.S. troops from south Korea without fail, the statement said.

articles.title: Actions for Probing Truth about U.S. Forces' Crimes Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Probing Truth about U.S. Forces' Crimes Launched in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Different circles of south Korea are conducting actions for thoroughly probing the truth about the case of environment pollution by the U.S. forces, according to Voice of People, an Internet radio of south Korea, on June 14.
					 The People's Measure Council Demanding Probe into the Case of Defoliant Burial by the U.S. Forces and Restoration of Polluted Environment said it is needed to make a comprehensive and thoroughgoing investigation into the U.S. troops' defoliant burial in its Waegwan military base.
					
					 The Council groups at least 80 organizations including the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society, the Green Federation and the Environment Movement Association.
					
					 It declared that it would intensify the action for probing the truth about the criminal deeds of the U.S. forces and restoring the polluted areas.
					
					 Civic and public organizations in Inchon said that they would make a thoroughgoing probe into the disposal of toxic materials by the U.S. forces in its Puphyong military base.
					
					 The Kunsan City, North Jolla Province, Assembly formed a joint investigation group with nongovernmental organizations to find facts about environment pollution in the Kunsan U.S. air-force base and went into action.
					
					 The management of Chunchon City, south Korean Kangwon Province, said that the primary results of investigation into the defoliant burial in the U.S. military base in the city failed to clear doubts about the case. It urged the Defense Ministry to come out for reinvestigation.

articles.title: Facts about Former Military Dictator's Introduction of Defoliant  Disclosed
articles.content:
Facts about Former Military Dictator's Introduction of Defoliant Disclosed 
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- It has been disclosed that the Park Chung-Hee military dictatorial forces were involved in the case of defoliant spraying in the Demilitarized Zone of south Korea in the late 1960s.
					 Jang Se Hwan, executive chairman of the Democratic Party of south Korea, on June 14 referred to this fact, quoting a report submitted by the Defense Ministry. The shocking fact has been confirmed that defoliant, used by the U.S. forces during the Vietnamese war, was massively shipped into south Korea at the request of the Park Chung-Hee regime, he said.
					
					 The then "prime minister," Jong Il Gwon, approved of the use of defoliant on September 20, 1967 and, consequently, a huge amount of defoliant and equipment and supplies needed for its spraying were introduced to south Korea from the U.S. on several installments from 1968, he noted.
					
					 He further said:
					
					 But the amount of defoliant sprayed at that time was about 11.5 times that the Park regime requested. This proves that the U.S. shipped a greater deal of defoliant into south Korea.
					
					 It has not yet been confirmed how much and through what channel defoliant was introduced and whether the U.S. got payment from the south Korean authorities or not. It is needed to make a thoroughgoing investigation into this matter.
					
					 If the Park regime was aware of harmfulness of defoliant before introducing it, this would be thrice-cursed atrocity, he said.
					
					 The crime of spraying defoliant, whereby many people suffered great pain, should be certainly judged by history, he stressed.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Anti-terror Exercise Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Anti-terror Exercise Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- The Inchon Citizens' Measure Committee of south Korea held a press conference on June 12 to protest against the anti-terror drill staged by the Puphyong-based U.S. forces against citizens.
					 Speakers at the press conference accused them of kicking up a row while staging what they called an anti-terrorist drill in the place where citizens were on a sit-in strike critical of the environmental pollution.
					
					 They held that such rash action was aimed at browbeating the citizens raising a just demand as regards the environmental pollution by the U.S. forces.
					
					 Any attempt of the U.S. forces to gloss over the environmental pollution would entail irrevocable consequences, they warned.

articles.title: UN Condemns Israel for Blockade of Gaza
articles.content:
UN Condemns Israel for Blockade of Gaza
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- The UN Relief and Works Agency on June 13 strongly condemned Israel for its persistent blockade of the Gaza Strip.
					 A spokesman for the agency quoted its report as saying that broad unemployment in the Gaza Strip in the second half of 2010 reached an unprecedented 45.2 percent, the world's highest, owing to the Israeli blockade. Since the first half of 2006 real wages continued to decline due to the increasing unemployment rate, falling 34.5 percent.
					
					 "It is hard to understand the logic of a man-made policy which deliberately impoverishes so many and condemns hundreds of thousands of potentially productive people to a life of destitution," he said.

articles.title: Iran Warns U.S. to Stop Scheme for Cyber Warfare
articles.content:
Iran Warns U.S. to Stop Scheme for Cyber Warfare
 Tehran, June 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of Iran warned that the United States would suffer a heavy defeat if it wages cyber warfare against Iran.
					 He made this warning during his recent weekly news briefing as regards the fact that the United States and certain other Western countries have drawn up to wage cyber warfare against Iran.
					
					 He said that the Western countries will suffer a crushing defeat in cyber warfare against the Islamic Republic.

articles.title: U.S. Drone Strikes Protested in Pakistan
articles.content:
U.S. Drone Strikes Protested in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Thousands of Pakistani tribesmen Thursday rallied against the U.S. drone strikes in North Waziristan tribal region and showed bodies of four civilians killed in a U.S. strike Wednesday.
					 The demonstrators criticized the U.S. and Western media for describing civilian people as militants. They strongly urged the U.S. to stop at one such unreasonable drone strikes.

articles.title: Volcano Ashes Erupt in Shebeluch Volcano, Russia
articles.content:
Volcano Ashes Erupt in Shebeluch Volcano, Russia
 Moscow, June 19 (KCNA) -- Volcano ashes erupted in Shebeluch Volcano, Kamchatka of Russia recently.
					 The ashes rose as high as 10 km above the sea level. An alarm signal was issued in this regard.

articles.title: China Publishes Priority Books to Celebrate CPC Birthday
articles.content:
China Publishes Priority Books to Celebrate CPC Birthday
 Beijing, June 19 (KCNA) -- The People's Literature Publishing House and the Science Press of China published full-length novel "Wuchangsheng" and "Brilliant 90 Years-Shining History of the Communist Party of China (CPC)" as priority books to celebrate the 90th birthday of the CPC.
					 "Wuchangsheng" deals with the historical facts about the 1926 civil war on Wuchang combat area. The other book shows the 90-year-long history of the CPC and the traits displayed by party members in every historic period.

articles.title: Chinese Senior Official Calls for Intensified Ideological Education
articles.content:
Chinese Senior Official Calls for Intensified Ideological Education
 Beijing, June 19 (KCNA) -- Li Changchun, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Communist Party of China, underscored the need to intensify the ideological education through the whole society.
					 Touring Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region from June 11 to 14, he called for public education to focus on patriotism to encourage more people to become engaged in the country's socialistic construction ahead of the 90th founding anniversary of the CPC.

articles.title: Collections of Songs Produced in China to Mark 90th Birthday of CPC
articles.content:
Collections of Songs Produced in China to Mark 90th Birthday of CPC
 Beijing, June 19 (KCNA) -- The General Record Company of China has recently produced collections of songs "Collection of Revolutionary Songs" and "We Are Communists" to celebrate the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China. 
					 "Collection of Revolutionary Songs" contains excellent songs created in different periods of the Chinese revolution and construction and "We Are Communists" typical songs on the traits of advanced fighters who serve for the interests of the collective and people.

articles.title: Immediate Halt to U.S. Saber-rattling against DPRK Demanded
articles.content:
Immediate Halt to U.S. Saber-rattling against DPRK Demanded 
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Some days ago the U.S. forces in south Korea conducted combined tactical exercises in Phaju City, Kyonggi Province with the puppet forces. Involved in the maneuvers were huge aggression troops including tanks, armored cars, artillery pieces and unmanned reconnaissance planes belonging to the 1st Brigade of the U.S. 2nd Division and the 2nd Armored Brigade of the 1st Corps of the puppet army.
					 Timed to coincide with these exercises, joint ground exercises were staged in Phaju and Koyang cities, Kyonggi Province, with civilians, administrative officials and police involved.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said saber-rattling is a blatant challenge to the DPRK and a revelation of a criminal scenario to escalate the military tension on the Korean Peninsula and ignite a war of aggression against it at any cost, the commentary notes, and continues:
					
					 The danger of the recent maneuvers lies in that they were just like an overture of a ground attack to be mounted on the DPRK from an area close to the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the U.S. imperialists hurled into the war maneuvers the Bradley armored cars which they  used in the land attack operations in Iraq in 2003.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the above-said tactical maneuvers were staged by the U.S. warmongers who are contemplating conducting joint military maneuvers in the waters around Paekryong Island with south Korean puppet forces in July.
					
					 It is their scenario to finally round off their naval strike operation in the waters around Paekryong Island and ground attack operation in the areas along the MDL in an effort to create a phase favorable for provoking the second Korean War. The combined tactical exercise staged by them in the area close to the MDL was to serve that purpose. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop at once the above-said adventurous saber-rattling.

articles.title: Sri Lanka Rejects British War Crime Video
articles.content:
Sri Lanka Rejects British War Crime Video
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Sri Lanka has rejected a gruesome video aired on a British channel which alleges the Sri Lankan military committed war crimes during the civil war.
					 The video shows men clad in military uniform killing unarmed men. 
					
					 The Sri Lankan External Affairs Ministry on June 15 charged that the video has the potential to incite hatred among different communities in Sri Lanka and thereby adversely affect the ongoing national reconciliation process.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Celebrated in India
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Celebrated in India
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Meeting, reading session, photo exhibition and film shows took place in India on June 7 and 9 to mark the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Displayed at their venues were photos on the feats Kim Jong Il performed in leading the party building and the greatness and vitality of the Songun politics.
					
					 Films shown included "Party Founding Memorial Tower" and "Arms of Korea". 
					
					 S. P. Pathak, chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Works of Kim Jong Il, said that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the WPK has turned into the party of President Kim Il Sung both in name and reality and the single-minded unity of the DPRK has been further cemented in one ideology and purpose around the leader.
					
					 All the signal successes now being made in economic construction of the DPRK are the fruition of the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il, the chairman noted.
					
					 The Juche idea followers of India are convinced that the DPRK will fly higher the banner of Juche, the banner of Songun under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, he said.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting held by the said society.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Ukraine
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Ukraine
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Ukrainian Independence Federation for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated with due ceremony in Kiev on June 12.
					 Vitali Kulik, chairman of the federation, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 He said at the ceremony that on the occasion of the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung the committee would study and widely disseminate his works and actively introduce the achievements made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A decision was adopted at the ceremony. It said:
					
					 We express our will to participate together with the world's Juche idea followers in a world conference on the Juche idea to be held in Pyongyang of the DPRK in April 2012.
					
					 Our task is to show that the idea of the President is the guidelines of the world's anti-imperialist fighters.
					
					 The Juche idea has become the theory and practice for the world revolution and the basis of activities of all the anti-imperialist forces.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the ceremony.

articles.title: Lectures Given to Mark Significant Day of DPRK
articles.content:
Lectures Given to Mark Significant Day of DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- Lectures were given in Kyrgyzstan, Dominica, Guinea and Nepal between June 10 and 13 to mark the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and welcome his successful visit to China.
					 The chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan said that Kim Jong Il has turned the WPK into an invincible party united in ideology and purpose and strong in militancy and led the Korean revolution to victory with his Songun leadership.
					
					 His recent historic visit to China is a great event as it not only boosted the traditional DPRK-China friendship but also made signal contribution to global independence, he added.
					
					 The general secretary of the Revolutionary Alternative Party of Dominica praised the undying feats of Kim Jong Il who has strengthened the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung both in name and reality.
					
					 The chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea at Kankan University of Guinea said that Kim Jong Il is the steadfast champion of ideology, the statesman attaching importance to ideology.
					
					 The achievements made in the DPRK prove that the Korean people will certainly build a thriving nation, he said.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the lecture in Nepal.

articles.title: Work Posted on Swiss Internet Website
articles.content:
Work Posted on Swiss Internet Website
 Pyongyang, June 20 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on June 14 posted on its Internet homepage the full text of general secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction".
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997), clarifies the idea that to preserve the Juche character and national character of the revolution and construction is the basic principle to be maintained in accomplishing the socialist cause and the tasks and ways to do so.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia intento de fabricar nueva ley anti-RPDC
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia intento de fabricar nueva ley anti-RPDC
						
 Pyongyang, 20 de junio (ATCC) -- En su informacion no. 973 fechada 20, el Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) condeno las pretensiones de la camarilla de traidores surcoreanos de fabricar la muy provocativa "ley de derechos humanos del Norte", pese al repudio categorico de la opinion publica interna y externa.
					  Esta ley de caracter conflictivo y anti-reunificacion persigue el muy siniestro objetivo politico de calumniar e insultar, bajo el pretexto de "DDHH", el sistema socialista y la maxima dignidad de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y derrumbarla desde adentro, comienza la nota y prosigue:
					
					  Si bien los titeres surcoreanos intentaron instituirla varias veces hasta la fecha, no lo pudieron hacer ante el rechazo rotundo de los nacionales y extranjeros.
					
					  Sin embargo, sacaron de nuevo ese proyecto de ley, que habia sido echado al basurero, y tratan  de aprobarlo en la "Asamblea Nacional", lo cual comprueba a que grado llega su fiebre conflictiva.
					
					  Tanto en vista de su caracter y objetivo como en su contenido, la "ley de DDHH del Norte" es la mas infame, anti-reunificacion, antinacional y anti-etica que la connotada "ley de seguridad".
					
					  Mediante la institucion de ella, los titeres surcoreanos pretenden justificar y asegurar por la ley todas sus campanas de enfrentamiento y complots como el secuestro y rapto de los habitantes de la RPDC y la guerra psicologica contra esta. A la larga, quieren satisfacer su absurda ambicion de lograr la "reunificacion" en la supuesta "situacion de emergencia" en la RPDC y "bajo el sistema democratico liberal".
					
					 La fabricacion de la "ley de DDHH del Norte" significaria la negativa total y oficial al regimen, la soberania y la dignidad de la RPDC y legalizaria la confrontacion con el regimen de ella. Ese acto antinacional y anti-reunificacion tiene por su meta invalidar totalmente los acuerdos Norte-Sur, que exigen reconocer y respetar el regimen de la contraparte, y llevar las relaciones intercoreanas al extremo de hermeticidad y enfrentamiento. 
					
					 En caso de que la camarilla de titeres surcoreanos invente por fin la "ley de DDHH del Norte" de caracter criminal, el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC, que consideran el socialismo como su vida, reaccionaran de modo rotundo e implacable tomandolo por la declaracion oficial de guerra contra su regimen y pueblo y como segundo "caso de los ejercicios de tiro con los blancos que ofenden la maxima dignidad de la RPDC". 
					
					 Si la banda de titeres surcoreanos sigue empecinada en la invencion de las infames leyes anti-RPDC pese a la advertencia de esta, se responsabilizara de todas sus consecuencias inimaginablemente graves.

articles.title: Orquesta Sinfonica Nacional ofrece funcion por el 19 de junio
articles.content:
Orquesta Sinfonica Nacional ofrece funcion por el 19 de junio
 Pyongyang, 20 de junio (ATCC) -- La Orquesta Sinfonica Nacional ofrecio el dia 19 en el Teatro Moranbong el concierto dedicado al 47o aniversario del inicio del trabajo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il en el Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea. 
					 La presenciaron los cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, y los funcionarios de los organismos del partido y las fuerzas armadas, entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales. 
					
					 En la escena se pusieron la musica orquestal "Nuestro General es el mejor", el solo de violin "Con la eterna fidelidad", la sinfonia en serie "Himno al Partido", el concierto de instrumentos de cuerda "Galopa el caballo Chollima", el soprano "Mi patria del Songun", etc.
					
					 Los ejecutantes cantaron en tono patetico el sentimiento de infinito respeto y agradecimiento hacia el Dirigente quien fortalecio el PTC como el partido del Presidente Kim Il Sung y como una poderosa fuerza orientadora de la revolucion del Songun y exalta a todo el mundo la dignidad y el poderio de la Corea del Juche. 
					
					 Las musicas orquestales "Abundante cosecha en campos de Chongsan" y "Muchacha en el columpio" dejaron muchas impresiones a los espectadores por su caracter Juche y nacionalidad.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena ejercicios belicos en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena ejercicios belicos en Sur de Corea
 Pyongyang, 20 de junio (ATCC) -- Segun trascendidos, hace poco, las tropas norteamericanas ocupantes del Sur de Corea realizaron junto con los titeres surcoreanos un ejercicio tactico conjunto en la ciudad de Phaju de la provincia de Kyonggi.
					 En la ocasion se movilizaron los tanques, carros blindados, canones y aviones no tripulados y otros muchos medios belicos de la primera brigada de la segunda division de Estados Unidos y de la segunda brigada blindada del primer cuerpo del ejercito titere surcoreano.
					
					 Paralelamente, en los alrededores de la citada ciudad y la otra de Koyang de la provincia de Kyonggi tuvo lugar el ejercicio conjunto terrestre con la incorporacion de los civiles, los funcionarios de administracion y los policias.
					
					 En un comentario individual difundido este lunes, el diario Rodong Sinmun denuncio que esas maniobras constituyen un desafio frontal a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y parten del intento criminal de desatar la guerra contra ella al exacerbar las tensiones militares en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					 El reciente ejercicio tactico conjunto resulto mas peligroso porque se llevo a cabo cerca de la Linea de Demarcacion Militar significando el preludio de ataque terrestre anti-RPDC, asevera el comentarista y continua:
					
					 Lo insoslayable del caso es que en esa ocasion participaron hasta los carros blindados "Bradley" que fueron usados en las operaciones terrestres durante la guerra iraqui de 2003.
					
					 A traves de esa maniobra y el ejercicio militar conjunto en los alrededores de la isla Paekryong, programado para julio que viene, los belicistas norteamericanos pretenden ultimar los detalles de las operaciones de ataque maritimo en la isla Paekryong y en la linea de Demarcacion Militar, de modo que se faciliten las condiciones de provocar la segunda guerra coreana.
					
					 EE.UU. debe parar ahora mismo sus aventureros ejercicios militares para la agresion a la RPDC.

articles.title: Competencia de futbol entre RPDC y Emiratos Arabes Unidos
articles.content:
Competencia de futbol entre RPDC y Emiratos Arabes Unidos
 Pyongyang, 20 de junio (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar la vispera en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung la primera disputa de la 2a etapa de eliminatoria de la region asiatica de futbol (m) entre las selecciones de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Emiratos Arabes Unidos para los Juegos Olimpicos de 2012.
					 El equipo de Emiratos Arabes Unidos gano al coreano por 1 a 0.
					
					 El proximo torneo se realizara el dia 23 en Emiratos Arabes Unidos.
